intro: Bidoupia phongii, commonly known as the Phong Hoa tree, is a rare and endemic species native to the Central Highlands of Vietnam. It belongs to the Rutaceae family, which includes citrus and other aromatic plants. The tree is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers and elliptical leaves with a slightly waxy texture. It thrives in humid, well-drained soils and is often found in secondary forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat loss, Bidoupia phongii is considered vulnerable and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
